string.name: explanation_1
string.font: The Content Resolver is the single, global instance in your application that provides access to your (and other applications\') content providers.

string.name: explanation_2
string.font: In Android the term layout refers to defining how the View components are displayed on the screen relative to each other.

string.name: explanation_3
string.font: A Fragment is a piece of an activity which enable more modular activity design. It will not be wrong if we say, a fragment is a kind of sub-activity.

string.name: explanation_4
string.font: The AndroidManifest.xml file contains information of your package, including components of the application such as activities, services, broadcast receivers, content providers etc.

string.name: explanation_5
string.font: Intents are messages that can be used to pass information to the various components of android.

string.name: explanation_6
string.font: Here they are: onAttach(); onCreateView(); onViewCreated(); onActivityCreated(); onStart(); onStop(); onDestroyView(); onDestroy(); onDetach()

string.name: explanation_7
string.font: Here they are: mediaPlayer.start(); mediaPlayer.pause(); mediaPlayer.reset();

string.name: explanation_8
string.font: Margin is outer space of an element, while padding is inner space of an element.
